English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>,
I'll tell you a secret.
I can read your thoughts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 너의 생각을 읽을 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): You cannot.
I can so. I'll prove it.
Imagine.
You're walking in the woods.
Suddenly, the path you're\non diverges into two.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러던 중, 갑자기\n길이 두 갈래로 나뉘어.

English (United States)(en-US): One is a brick-lined road,\nbright with sunshine.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 쪽은 햇살이 가득한\n벽돌 깔린 길이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Fragrant flowers neatly grow on the side
and the red, orange, and yellow\nof the blooms catch your eye.
The other has trees of all sizes\nstretching out from everywhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 쪽은 다양한 크기의 나무들이\n아무데서나 자라고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Thick greenery sways\nwildly with the wind
and a calm darkness\nblankets the scene.
Which path would you choose?
The road with flowers.|The tree-filled road.
It seems beautiful and safe.
Hmm. Interesting!
Okay.
Then, as you are walking\nyour chosen path,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 선택한 길을 따라 걷고 있던 너는,

English (United States)(en-US): you see a pouch of water and\na dog on the side of the road.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 길가에 물 주머니와 강아지\n한 마리가 있는 걸 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): A note beside it says:
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 옆에 있는 종이엔 이렇게 적혀 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): “You may wish to take two\nbut can only take one.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “당신에겐 두 손이 있겠지요. 하지만\n다음 행인을 위해 하나만 가져가세요.”

English (United States)(en-US): It seems you can choose only one.\nWhich would you take with you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오직 하나만 선택할 수 있나 봐.\n어떤 걸 가져갈래?

English (United States)(en-US): The pouch of water, of course. | The dog.
I may have a long way to go.
Fascinating!
Now, let's take a look at the results.
The first choice reveals\nyour deepest fear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첫 번째 질문은 너의 가장\n깊은 두려움을 드러내.

English (United States)(en-US): You chose the road with flowers.
It's bright and safe. Birds are chirping\nand butterflies rest on your shoulder.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳은 밝고 안전해.새가 지저귀고\n나비가 네 어깨에 내려앉지.

English (United States)(en-US): But how about the\npath lined with trees?
At first the cool shade\nmay have pleased you.
But the looming shadows might\nswallow you before you know it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 어느새 거대해진\n그림자들이 너를 삼킬지 몰라!

English (United States)(en-US): You're afraid of the\ndarkness, aren't you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 분명 어둠에 대한 두려움이 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Afraid of the unknown, of what might\nleap out at you from who knows where!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어둡고 비밀스러운 것, 어디에서 무엇이\n튀어나올지 모르는 미지의 공포를 마주하는 것!

English (United States)(en-US): Think back to your very first\nnightmare when you were little!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어릴 때 꾸었던 최초의 악몽을 기억해 봐!

English (United States)(en-US): You were on a mountain\nroad past midnight,
and a vicious beast tore you\nto shreds with its teeth!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 서슬 퍼런 짐승의 어금니에 붙잡혀\n뜯겨 나가던 꿈이었을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Then, the second choice.
It was about who you are when\nfaced with an unsure future.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불확실한 미래를 앞두고 어떻게\n행동하는지에 대한 질문이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): If you chose the pouch of water,
it means you value where you\nare going over who you are with.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누구와 가고 있는지보단 어디로 가고\n있는지를 중요시한다는 뜻이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Interesting... so you're\nalways be thinking ahead.
I knew it, <nickname>!
You were always prepared for\nany question, any problem I had.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 넌 내가 가진 어떤 질문에도,\n고민에도 답을 내놓았지.

English (United States)(en-US): I knew I could count on you.
But let's just say—assume,\nreally, completely theoretically.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 이런 상황이면 어떨까?\n완전, 그저, 오로지 가정일 뿐이야!

English (United States)(en-US): You saw a pouch of water and\nme on the side of the road.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 길가에 물 주머니랑 내가\n나란히 있는 걸 봤다면.

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe.
Which would you choose?
The pouch of water.|You.
Well.
Goodbye. For now.\nI'll be crying over there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕. 나는 저 구석에서 울고 있을게.

English (United States)(en-US): Just in case you care.
I'm glad.
It's nice to know that I mean more\nto you than a pouch of water!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 물 주머니보단 의미\n있는 존재라니 기뻐!

English (United States)(en-US): I'll be quietly celebrating\nin the corner over there.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 꼭 추가하고\n싶은 게 하나 있는데,

English (United States)(en-US): is your eyeball.

English (United States)(en-US): What? Dot, why on earth would\nyou want something ike that?

I thought you would have seen the\nwide world with your two eyes.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (무시무시한 생각이다....) 다시 한 번 생각해 보는 건 어떨까?

English (United States)(en-US): (Please...!)
<nickname>, what does\nit mean to be complete?
To be whole.|To be flawless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 게 갖추어진 것.|부족함이 없는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): And does being whole and flawless mean
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 게 갖추어지고 부족함이 없다는 건

English (United States)(en-US): that one fills, swallows,\npaints, and grows,

English (United States)(en-US): Do you want to be complete, too?
I wouldn't say no to it.|Nah. I'm fine with who I am.

English (United States)(en-US): Interesting...
Share with me what faint clouds in your life
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 네 삶의 잔구름들이 너의\n그 대답을 만들어 냈는지

English (United States)(en-US): led you to that answer.\nI want to know more about you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간을 들여 나에게 알려줘.\n네가 더 궁금해졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course! If you're interested.
But <nickname>. Can completion\nalso be called growth?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 <nickname>. 완전해지는\n건 곧 성장이라고 부를 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps growth is just\nexperiencing another form.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 성장이란 어쩌면 그냥 다른\n모양을 경험하는 건 아닐지.

English (United States)(en-US): From someone you don't like\ninto someone you can.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음에 들지 않는 나에서\n마음에 드는 나로.

English (United States)(en-US): From an inexperienced, foolish\nme to a relaxed, mature me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미숙하고 치기 어린 나에서\n여유롭고 관능적인 나로.

English (United States)(en-US): If, while changing into what I believe\nis a better me, I long for who I used to be
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더 나아지고 있다는 믿음으로 모습을 바꾸는\n와중에, 이전의 순수함을 동경하게 된다면

English (United States)(en-US): won't it be too late to go back?
Hmm. <nickname>.
Do you ever want to\nprotect your innocence?
Hmm... in what way?
I mean, have you ever missed\nthe person you once were.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너 자신의 본래적인 형태를 그리워한 적이 있냐는 뜻이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Picture it again. The 'you'\nthat was closest to 'you'.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 다시 떠올려 보는 거야. 가장\n'너'와 가까웠던 '너'의 모습을.

English (United States)(en-US): Who I was when I was untainted...
I think I know you better now,\nand my heart is squirming.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금 더 친해진 것 같아,\n내 마음이 꾸물거리고 있네.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh! <nickname>.
If, perhaps, I might speak on\nwho I see when I look at you,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또는, 어쩌면, 내가 보는\n너의 모습을 말해 주자면

English (United States)(en-US): could it be you still have that pure\ngaze from when you were a child?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 안에는 여전히 아이일 때의\n투명한 눈짓이 남아 있는 건 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): After all, you're the one who discovered me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달나라에서 온 나를 발견해 준 너니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Now I'm going to be still and watch\nthose mold spores drift midair.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 이제 아주 오랫동안 미동 없이 앉아서\n저 곰팡이의 포자들이 부유하는 걸 바라볼 거야.

English (United States)(en-US):
I won't expect anything out\nof it.
I'll merely observe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 어떤 것도 바라지\n않은 채, 바라만 볼 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): You must be fond of being bored.|Any reason?
Yes. Boredom is like dry dough, before\nyou add water and make it sticky.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 지루함은 찰기 없는 밀가루\n같은 감촉을 가지고 있거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Good to roll around in.
Huh. And where is it\nthat you're rolling around in?
A field of misery.
Oh? .... Why?
If those spores settle somewhere nice, soon\nenough the whole family will be spotted.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 쟤네, 살기 좋은 어딘가에 안착한다면\n곧 다글다글 번식해서 인간의 눈에 띌 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And they'll be removed.\nIn the blink of an eye.
Either burnt alive or melted down.
If they settle somewhere less savory,\nthey'll avoid being noticed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 살기 나쁜 어딘가에 안착한다면\n인간의 눈은 피할 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): But they'll starve to death.
Slow and helpless....
The life sucked out of them,\nleft to dry and crumble.
I shouldn't expect anything else.\nBecause if that faith is broken...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 그 무엇도 바라지 못해. 걸어\n두었던 희망이 꺾여서 돌아오면...

English (United States)(en-US): It'll hurt. A lot.
(But what good is mold?)|(I'm feeling sorry for the mold.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (곰팡이가 번식해서 좋을 게 있나?)|(곰팡이가 괜히 안쓰러워 보여.)

English (United States)(en-US): It's only mold. Horrid to the\neye and harmful to humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고작 곰팡이일 뿐이야. 보기에도\n흉하고 인간에게 무익해.

English (United States)(en-US): But so am I. Do you see me\nthe way you see them?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 나도 마찬가지 아니야?\n너에겐 나도 '고작' 뭉치인 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): ....... <nickname>.
No, never. You're so\nmuch more than mold!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니야. 고작 뭉치가 아닌 무려 뭉치지!

English (United States)(en-US): You're my friend.|You're lovable.
Plus, you have no effect\non lung capacity whatsoever.
I see. I need some time\nto think. Excuse me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나. 시간이 필요해. 잠시 혼자 있어야겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I bet some of those spores fall onto the\nbread. Like children jumping on the bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저 빵 위로 떨어지는 애들도 있을걸.\n폭신한 침대에 뛰어드는 아이처럼!

English (United States)(en-US): They'll live their fluffy happy\ndays together with their family.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 아이들은 그들의 곰팡이 가족과\n폭신폭신 행복하게 살 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): You really think so?
I see.
Thank you, <nickname>.
Now I'm going to be still and hope\nfor them to fall onto the bread.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 이제 아주 오랫동안 미동 없이 앉아서\n얘네가 빵 위로 떨어지길 바라 볼 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): For a very long time.
